result.execSummary:
The defendant Ebony L Sims was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month commencing October 15, 2015 or penalty of 2 years suspension of Driver's License for non-payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ebony L Sims

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

ADDRESS INFO for Ebony L Sims
Current: 7307 Port Washington Road #304, Milwaukee, WI 53217 United States  (Effective: 08-28-2015)
Prior: 1629 S 7th St,#4, Milwaukee, WI 53204

Defendant Ebony L Sims in court with attorney Nick Martinez for Jess Martinez.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State amends the charges to an disorderly contact ordianance 13-102(c)(8).  Defendant pleads no contest. Court finds the defendant guilty.  Court dismisses the criminal complaint.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Martinez makes statements. 
Court does the following:
FINE:  $267.50 to be paid at the rate of $50.00 a month commencing 10/15/2015.  Failure to pay may result in up to a 2 year drivers suspension.
Jury status hearing on August 27, 2015 at 10:30 am.
